messages.title: Community safety and youth services
messages.content: We need more community support and police officers; the establishment of local neighbourhood safety forums and regular open meetings between the police and young people. In my first year, I will also deliver funding for new youth centres and a youth counsellor in every school.

messages.title: Invest in Whipps Cross Hospital and social care
messages.content: In my first year, Labour will commit to a fully-funded, environmentally sustainable Whipps Cross to meet the needs of the growing population. I will also achieve Labour’s aim of reducing private involvement in social care infrastructure.

messages.title: High quality education for all
messages.content: Labour will ensure a reversal of funding cuts, school repairs, and an increase in SEND funding. We will have smaller class sizes, restore bursaries, introduce arts in schools, and end the trend to forced academisation.

messages.title: My pledges to you
content: A safer community: We will invest in police and vital services so we can cut crime.
Invest in NHS & social care: We will deliver a world class Whipps Cross to meet the needs of our growing population.
High quality education: I want every child to reach their full potential. We will reverse school cuts and invest in pupils.
A final say on Brexit: We will bring a credible deal alongside a remain option for you to have a final say.
Reviving our high streets: We’ll invest in to keep our town centres alive.

messages.title: Personal statement
messages.content: It is a great honour to run to be the MP in the area where I was born, where I went to school, where I got my first job at 15 and got married. To this community that shaped who I am, I will use my skills - from those I learned attending my local primary, to my role as an economist and campaigner. I have delivered an award-winning national campaign, spoken locally and internationally at the United Nations, as well as managed teams employed to gather data on inequality. Coming full circle back to my home - and I will fight for you.

messages.title: Why we’re supporting Dr Faiza
content: Crashing out of the EU with no deal will leave us all poorer. Faiza is the only remain candidate standing in Chingford and Woodford Green and she has spent the past 20 years working on social justice and equality issues. Faiza has the expertise and experience to fight climate change, challenge the embrace of the UKIP politics of fear and division, and bring a new energy to our politics. We campaign for the many, not the few. The people of Chingford and Woodford Green have been through enough with 34 years of one constituency MP. We believe Faiza Shaheen can and will make a difference. Let’s make that change together.

As a mother of young children I am concerned about rising pollution which has made my son’s asthma worse. Faiza promotes global food campaigns and projects and she has the experience and expertise we need in Parliament – so we are lending her our votes.

Reversal of funding cuts, school repairs, increase in SEND funding, smaller class sizes, restore bursaries, introduce arts in schools, end forced academisation.
Bring a credible deal alongside a remain option for a final say.

quotes.text: Voting Labour in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.

examples: Voting Labour in this election is vital if you want to see a new way of doing things, where community comes first.
